issues.description: The solution's constructor is declared with package-private visibility (no access modifier) while the problem statement asks students to "Create a constructor that initializes every attribute" without specifying visibility. This creates a potential visibility mismatch: students will reasonably implement a public constructor (and tests or external code may expect to instantiate Lecture from outside the package). A package-private constructor in the solution/template can prevent instantiation from other packages (or from typical external test harnesses) and thus may cause confusion or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor explicitly public in both the template and the solution (e.g. `public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors)`) or explicitly document in the problem statement that a package-private constructor is intended. This ensures students and external tests can instantiate the class without visibility issues.
